title: 108_s362
content: The Act is titled the "Social Security Family Protection Act" and amends Section 202 of the Social Security Act regarding the termination of monthly insurance benefits upon death. The "Social Security Family Protection Act" amends Section 202 of the Social Security Act to address the termination of monthly insurance benefits upon death. If an individual dies within the first 15 days of a month, their benefit will be reduced to 50% and rounded down to the nearest dollar. This adjustment applies after all other benefit adjustments have been made. Additionally, Section 223 is amended to address the termination of disability insurance benefits upon death. The amendment addresses the termination of monthly insurance benefits upon death, reducing the benefit to 50% if the individual dies within the first 15 days of the month. This adjustment applies after all other benefit adjustments have been made. The amendment reduces monthly insurance benefits by 50% if the individual dies within the first 15 days of the month, with the adjusted payment made in accordance with section 204(d). The Social Security Act is being amended to adjust old-age insurance benefits and wife's insurance benefits, including changes to the month in which benefits end. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust husband's insurance benefits, including changes to the month in which benefits end. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust child's and widow's insurance benefits, specifying the months in which benefits end. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust widower's, mother's, father's, and parent's insurance benefits, specifying the conditions under which benefits end, such as remarriage or death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust parent's insurance benefits and disability insurance benefits, specifying the conditions under which benefits end, such as parent's death or remarriage. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust parent's insurance benefits and disability insurance benefits, specifying conditions for benefit termination. Additionally, amendments are made regarding benefits at age 72 for certain uninsured individuals and an exemption from the maximum benefit cap. Exemption from maximum benefit cap for certain amounts received under specific sections. Amendments made by this Act apply to deaths occurring 180 days after enactment.
